com.googlecode.jaks.common.io

Class StreamUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.googlecode.jaks.common.io.StreamUtil

  • public final class StreamUtil
extends Object
    Utility methods for InputStreams, OutputStreams, Readers, and Writers.
    Author:
    Jason Smith

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static String DEFAULT_CHARSET
      The system-default character set.
      static String US_ASCII
      Literally 'US-ASCII'; for use with methods that take a char-set encoding value.
      static String UTF8
      Literally 'UTF-8'; for use with methods that take a char-set encoding value.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static void transfer(InputStream source, OutputStream target)
      Transfer all the bytes from the source to the target, calling the close() method for both on exit.
      static void transfer(Reader source, Writer target)
      Transfer all the characters from the source to the target, calling the close() method for both on exit.
      static void write(String text, OutputStream target, String charset)
      Write the source text string to the target output stream.
      static void write(String text, Writer target)
      Write the source text string to the target writer.

    • Method Detail

      • transfer

        public static void transfer(Reader source,
            Writer target)
                     throws IOException
        Transfer all the characters from the source to the target, calling the close() method for both on exit. Source is wrapped in a BufferedReader; target is wrapped in a BufferedWriter.
        Parameters:
        source - The source character stream.
        target - The target character stream.
        Throws:
        IOException - See IOException.
        See Also:
        NonClosingReader, NonClosingWriter

      • transfer

        public static void transfer(InputStream source,
            OutputStream target)
                     throws IOException
        Transfer all the bytes from the source to the target, calling the close() method for both on exit. Source is wrapped in a BufferedInputStream; target is wrapped in a BufferedOutputStream.
        Parameters:
        source - The source byte stream.
        target - The target byte stream.
        Throws:
        IOException - See IOException.
        See Also:
        NonClosingInputStream, NonClosingOutputStream

      • write

        public static void write(String text,
         Writer target)
                  throws IOException
        Write the source text string to the target writer.
        Parameters:
        source - The source text.
        target - The target writer.
        Throws:
        IOException - See transfer(Reader, Writer).

      • write

        public static void write(String text,
         OutputStream target,
         String charset)
                  throws IOException
        Write the source text string to the target output stream.
        Parameters:
        source - The source text.
        target - The target output stream.
        charset - The character-encoding of the data.
        Throws:
        IOException - See transfer(InputStream, OutputStream).
